intro: Asclepias asperula subsp. capricornu, commonly known as the capricorn milkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the Apocynaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and clusters of small, orange to yellowish flowers. It produces distinctive seed pods that split open to release silky, parachute-like seeds. This species is an important food source for monarch butterflies and other pollinators.
